Subject: User-Agent and From HTTP header values not getting picked up
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=299187869; y=RBWOH5rjQ7aMV2eGRBFVRA3SJ1DYxOLoqlgi1lKq_z0j4M7E_Qw7

I've set up Heritrix on a fresh Ubuntu edgy (6.10) server with the  
sun java packages (1.5.0) from multiverse.  I started up heritrix and  
followed the "quick guide to running your first crawl job" from the  
User Manual.

However, when I actually start the job, I get an error that I've  
failed to set the User-Agent and From header values:

On crawl: testcrawl You must set the User-Agent and From HTTP header  
values to acceptable strings.
  User-Agent: [software-name](+[info-url])[misc]
  From: [email-address]

However, I did in fact set these to reasonable values while setting  
up the job.  And when I look in the order.xml file for the job, the  
values are properly set there as well.

     <map name="http-headers">
       <string name="user-agent">Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; heritrix/ 
1.10.2 testrun)</string>
       <string name="from">myemailaddress@...</string>
     </map>

I'm clearly missing something trivial here, but I didn't turn up  
anything in the FAQ or the list archives. Any pointers appreciated.

Thanks,
-jared
